title: An attempt to rethink a music sequencer design
author: peterrudenko
content: readme.md helio workstation is free open-source music sequencer, designed be used all major platforms.why another sequencer? of daw interfaces often seem overcomplicated, they tend get more more bloated time. most the daws are commercial, proprietary-licensed almost none them support major operating systems the same .helio aims be modern music creation tool, featuring linear-based sequencer a clean interface, high-performance c++ core, integrated version control providing intelligent synchronization between devices, saved undo history, translations many languages more.buildinglinuxwindowsmacosiosmasterdevelopbasic build instructionsgit clone, juce submodule, not yet done: git submodule update --init, vst asio sdks ( can't redistributed this project due licensing restrictions, you may thirdparty/get_asio_and_vst_sdks.sh script download extract sdks sources they're found), may skip step macos ios projects, the download script be invoked automatically the pre-build phase, linux, 'll need have following packages installed: libfreetype6-dev libx11-dev libxinerama-dev libxrandr-dev libxcursor-dev libxcomposite-dev mesa-common-dev freeglut3-dev libcurl4-openssl-dev libasound2-dev libjack-dev,pick right project your os projects directory build.linkshomepage all latest builds: https://helioworkstation.com.project page kvr database. screencasts youtube.contributinghelio is work progress still are many essential features missing, pull requests are appreciated. ideas are welcome: friendly lightweight ui is main development priority this project, if have vision how improve user experience music composing, feel free share .you also a translation your native language improve of existing translations, include english, german, french,
